sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph. 

![Graph with vertices A, B, C, D, E and edges connecting them](https://i.imgur.com/NFC7dAi.png)

Does this graph have a Hamiltonian cycle? If so, give one example of such a cycle. If not, explain why not.
message_2:
Yes, this graph has a Hamiltonian cycle. A Hamiltonian cycle is a cycle that visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex. One example of a Hamiltonian cycle in this graph is:

A -> B -> C -> D -> E -> A
